required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Establish a Vegetable Signature Database From Human Metabolomics Responses
clinical_study.official_title: Establish a Vegetable Signature Database From Human Metabolomics Responses

brief_summary.textblock: Vegetable is well known to prevent chronic disease,however, the mechanism of its nutrients and non-nutrients still remains to be discovered.We design a feeding study which provides plant foods to subjects one by another and monitoring metabolomic changes up to 7 hours.The goal of this study is to establish a protocol for documenting metabolomics response to plant foods and try to characterize plant foods in terms of their anti-hypertension potentials with metabolomic profiling information.

primary_outcome.description: fasting, before lunch,and every 1 hr after lunch

secondary_outcome.measure: metabolomic profile of serum and urine
secondary_outcome.description: serum sample will be measure fasting ,before lunch,and every 1 hr after lunch;urine sample will be measure fasting ,before lunch(0hr),0-2 hr,2-4hr 4-7hr after lunch

clinical_study.condition: Human Metabolomic Responses to Plant Foods

intervention.intervention_name: Low phytochemical diet(LPD), high phytochemical diet(HPD)
intervention.description: LPD is a basal diet which low in soy,vegetable and fruit and other plant food to approach low phytochemical. HPD is the diet which add two serving test vegetable in the lunch of LPD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age :18-60 years
- Body Mass Index :18.5-30(kg/m2)
- Non-smoking,alcohol abusing,and other bad hobbies
Exclusion Criteria:
- With regular drug intake e.g. anti-hypertensive or antidiabetes drug or history of immune, hepatic and metabolic disease or other unsuitable disorders e.g. cancer.
- unwilling to stop regular food supplement e.g. vitamins, herb
- cannot cooperate with designed diet
- History of urinary tract infection or antibiotic use within the previous 3 month
